award_title: Enhancing Undergraduate STEM Education with Large Language Models: Personalization, Collaboration, and Active Learning
subject: Credit for computational work beyond citations
body:
Hi Sashank,

I came across your IUSE project on using LLMs for personalized learning in CS courses—particularly the retrieval-augmented generation work to align outputs with student materials.

One challenge with computational methods: citations capture acknowledgment, but not actual influence. When other researchers build on your RAG techniques or LLM customizations, there's no easy way to see that usage.

Ouro provides a thin API layer over computational workflows, letting other researchers reuse methods directly instead of recreating them from papers. It makes computational contributions both citable and visibly used.

Hope winter break gives you some downtime—happy holidays.

Let me know if you'd like to poke around.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
